title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
Air 820-3208 logic board with all rails present. 


PP1V05_S0 Seems to be shorted to ground. When trying SMC BYPASS mode fan tries to spin but stop immediatly. 


Checked all PP1V05_S0 circuit components with few resistors with wrong value. Changed them, but there is no change. Can't find where the short is.

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: If 1v05 is missing NOT all rails are present! Voltage on PP1v05_S0? Any pulse of voltage on VCore?

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: No pulse, all other rails are presents. Also PP1V05_S0 is shorted ( resistance to ground 12ohms)

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: Ok so no VCore means something is indeed missing and in this case 1v05. I?d say inject voltage and see what heats up. Start lower voltage wise like 0.5 volts

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: When injecting nothing is warming and short desappear. It takes all 0,5 Volts i inject. :S

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: It could be anything on 1v05_S0 including the PCH and CPU. Thermal cam or freeze spray would help a lot

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: will try to buy freeze spray. But how it's possible that injecting i get the voltage and with magsafe it's shorted?

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: You're measuring resistance with power applied??? I hope not as that's a great way to ruin your multimeter.....

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: No,  I only measure Voltage. And that is what i cant understand. If it is shorted it must be shorted by magsafe or injecting directly to rail. right?

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
There is no short; STOP to inject voltage without reason.
Did you compare same power rail with a good board???
12 ohms is normal value for PCH core!

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: 12 ohms seems kinda low for that board, but yeah if you're measuring for a short with power applied, that's going to cause issues.

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 49024"]There is no short; STOP to inject voltage without reason.
Did you compare same power rail with a good board???
12 ohms is normal value for PCH core![/QUOTE]

No informaticos. I dont have another board to compare. I compared it with other board same rail and tester is not beeping with ground. Any idea?

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
Different values, for VCORE and 1V05 power rails, depending what chips used in each board.

3023 uses Cougar Point PCH and Sandy Bridge CPU.
015 / 007.

3024 same as 3023
008 / 017.

3208 uses Panther Point PCH and Ivy Bridge CPU.
*not available to test*

3437 uses Haswell-ULT (intel MCP).
040 / 090.

00165 uses Broadwell-ULT (Intel MCP).
010 / 140.

All values in diode mode, red probe to ground; VCORE / 1V05 rails.
Values vary from board to board (even same model), and depends by multimeter and CPU type (i3-5-7)...
BTW, I got them from non-working boards; but no short detected anywhere.

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
In diode mode i am getting 0.015 ( red to ground)

Reistance to ground 13 OHMS. what else i can check if that is ok?

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message: Also changed U7600 ( there was a little water damage near) but that didnt fixed my problem. board still not turning on

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
Post some voltages for U7600; pins 13, 14, 3.
Be sure all traces, solders and surrounding components are good.

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
Pin 3,13,14 - 0V


I noticed that C7602 and C7601 have very smal burn on pin 1. Will change them tomorrow and tell you result here. Thanks

title: 820-3208 not turning on
message:
Do you even get 5V_S0?
Post all S3 and S0 voltages prenent on the board.
